intro: Ozoroa longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. Ozoroa longipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
